name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Respondent, v. Joseph M. CLECKLEY, Jr., Petitioner

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Respondent, v. Joseph M. CLECKLEY, Jr., Petitioner.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 14th day of August, 1998, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is granted limited to the question:
“When an otherwise illegal search is sought to be validated on the basis of purported consent, must the court employ a waiver analysis, as opposed to a simple ‘voluntariness’ standard.”
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: John J. Petrush, Jr., Beaver, for petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
713 A.2d 1143
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Respondent, v. Joseph M. CLECKLEY, Jr., Petitioner.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Aug. 14, 1998.
John J. Petrush, Jr., Beaver, for petitioner.
